Joseph Catholic School in Petersburg, VA, is seeking a passionate and dedicated Middle School Theology Teacher to join our faculty. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in Catholic theology, a deep commitment to the faith, and a desire to inspire young minds. This individual will be responsible for creating an engaging and dynamic religious education program for students in grades 5-8. Responsibilities:

Develop and implement a comprehensive theology curriculum in alignment with the Catholic Church's teachings and school guidelines.

Create lesson plans that foster critical thinking, spiritual growth, and a deeper understanding of the Catholic faith.

Facilitate discussions and activities that encourage students to explore and articulate their faith.

Collaborate with other faculty members to integrate Catholic values across the curriculum.

Participate in school-wide events, liturgies, and community service projects.

Maintain open communication with parents regarding student progress and spiritual development.

Attend faculty meetings, professional development sessions, and religious education workshops.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Theology, Religious Studies, Education, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).

Practicing Catholic in good standing with a strong understanding of Catholic doctrine and traditions.

Previous teaching experience at the middle school level is preferred.

Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.

Ability to create a positive and inclusive classroom environment.

Commitment to the mission and values of Catholic education.

The Specialist will maintain a diverse and current media collection (electronic and print) and will facilitate student and staff use of these resources in the media center. About Sacred Heart Center Sacred Heart Center connects Latino families with tools to thrive and flourish. Our work manifests through: A continuum of educational opportunities for adults, innovative programs for youth and children, and strategic partnerships to meet community needs. We envision a Richmond community that actively embraces each other in our shared humanity. Position Overview The Adult Education Programs Coordinator provides direction and leadership for the overall planning, coordination, administration, and evaluation of Sacred Heart Center’s Adult Education Programs, including GED, ESL, Plaza Comunitaria, Citizenship, Conversational Spanish, and the Latino Leadership Institute. This position reports to the Director of Programs and supervises a team of paid and unpaid staff which includes the Adult Education Program Assistant, ESL and GED Lead Teachers, GED Subject Matter Teachers, Spanish Teacher, LLI Facilitator, and ESL, Plaza, and Citizenship Volunteer Teachers. Key Areas of Responsibility

Lead short- and long-term planning to sustain and strengthen current program infrastructure, aligned with Strategic Plan, needs assessments, and resources available; expand as appropriate.

Coordinate the development, implementation, evaluation, and supervision of adult education program curricula, goals, objectives, activities, calendar, and schedule.

Monitor and evaluate program outcomes, including student attendance, retention, and educational progress, and instructor performance.

Coordinate student outreach, registration, diagnostic exams, orientation, advising, and maintenance of student records.

Coordinate payment processing, financial recordkeeping, and account reconciliation.

Establish and maintain a collaborative work environment that leverages the talents and strengths of staff and provides appropriate autonomy to be productive at the highest levels.

In partnership with the Director of Programs, ensure that adult education programs, activities, staff, and volunteers follow all laws, Diocesan regulations, program procedures, policies, and protocols, and adult education best practices.

Collaborate with other Program Coordinators to connect individuals and families with wraparound services as needed.

Keys to Success:

100% follow-through

Customer service orientation, and ability to connect with youth and families

Attention to detail

Positive attitude, solution-focused, and flexibility

Ability to collaborate with others

Experience and Attributes: Ideal candidates for this position will share our commitment to our mission and to our values of compassion, inclusion, equity, and collaboration, and have related experience, including:

Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum two years’ experience in a human service organization or youth development field

Ability to connect with others and forge strong relationships, especially youth

Bilingual in Spanish and English, bicultural

Highly organized, analytical, IT-competent – proficient in Microsoft Office programs

Ability to perform several tasks concurrently, time management and organizational skills

Ability to organize and maintain detailed records, complete necessary paperwork, and meet deadlines

Exemplary record of strong communication and interpersonal skills and customer service focus, excellent follow-up, and an ability to work with diverse groups in a courteous and professional manner

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, flexibility to work occasional evenings and weekends is necessary

Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and a commitment to and passion for SHC’s mission

Key Responsibilities The Receptionist serves as the first point of welcoming contact for visitors and callers at the Sacred Heart Center during regular business hours. The Receptionist will handle incoming calls and inquiries, providing assistance directly or routing them to the appropriate staff member. The Receptionist will also support registration and intake processes across all program portfolios, which include Adult Education, Youth Programs, and Community Initiatives. Offer friendly, professional, useful, and compassionate customer service to individuals visiting or seeking services and/or assistance from Sacred Heart Center.

Respond to in-person inquiries, phone calls, emails, and voicemails by providing pertinent information and/or referring to appropriate staff or taking messages when necessary. Receive deliveries and manage distribution.

Under the guidance of the Administrative Program Assistant, ensure the organized and efficient functioning of the reception area.

Provide building and program administration support:

Prepare the building for the classes, programs, and meetings of the day; set up for special events. Work in collaboration with Sacred Heart Parish staff to monitor door camera and unlock door for visitors.

Ensure classrooms are set up for evening classes, programs, and meetings. Monitor door camera and open door for visitors. At the end of the evening, ensure building is shut down and secure.

Assist Administrative Program Assistant in processing student payments for Adult Education and Youth Programs according to protocols for class and program fees and textbooks.

Make food pantry and other appointments (i.e. tax site, vaccination clinic, registration as needed) using data collection system provided by program coordinator.

Provide intake/outreach support to programs and ensure accurate data collection/records maintenance

Other duties as assigned

Works with Partner Teacher at partner school to conduct marketing, outreach, and recruitment of youth participants.

Conduct weekly outreach to parents/guardians of student participants.

Schedule transportation needs with the Youth Programs Coordinator to ensure students are picked up on time and taken back safely to their homes at the end of the program.

Communicate weekly with Partner Teacher about session plans and to monitor students’ performance in school and facilitate wraparound services.

Ensure that youth and youth organizations are aware of the CCB program, in coordination with Youth Programs Coordinator.

Prepare program reports for CCB as designated by funding sources.

Ensure that all CCB activities and volunteer screening and onboarding are implemented and operating according to relevant policies and procedures.

Other tasks

Support other Center youth programs on an as needed basis

Support additional administrative needs of office on an as needed basis

Work as part of a team with other SHC staff to accomplish overall organizational goals

Attend team and all-staff meetings as available

100% follow-through

Attention to detail

Positive attitude, solution-focused, and flexibility

Ability to connect with others and forge strong relationships, especially with youth.

Bilingual in Spanish and English, bicultural.

Highly organized, analytical, IT-competent – proficient in Microsoft Office programs.

Ability to perform several tasks concurrently, time management and organizational skills.

Ability to organize and maintain detailed records; complete necessary paperwork and meet deadlines

Exemplary record of strong communication skills and customer service focus, excellent follow-up, and an ability to work with diverse groups in a courteous and professional manner.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and to work one to two afternoons/evenings a week and some Saturdays is necessary.

An understanding about barriers that communities of color face in pursuing higher education.

Experience in the process of applying to a university, other post-secondary opportunities, or in pursuing a career post high school graduation.
